pr_title: Enable verbose logging for Robolectric tests

timeline.message: Enable verbose logging for Robolectric tests

timeline.bodyText: No problem here, but should we have a data-driven configuration for this logger?
timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: Not sure what you mean, can you elaborate a bit more?
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: Often, logging parameters are set up via a file or other resource external to the application, not strictly in code.  I see that this is wrapping android's logging, which I guess we're trying to shield from too much messaging.  I was expecting to see a change to logging config.  It seems like we might want one?  Normally, in these configurations, you can turn on or off logging or control log level by class or package (in this case it would be tag).
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText:
We could also do it through the MSAL config file. See this: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/msal-configuration#logging
Although that does similar things to what can be achieved via code. We do not have class level or package level config at this time.
replies.author: shahzaibj
